revised_title: Immunizing Effects of Intracellular Contents of Typhoid Bacillus Using Liquid Air Disintegration
tldr: The authors investigate the immunizing effects of intracellular contents of the typhoid bacillus obtained by disintegrating the organism at liquid air temperatures. They find that the serum of treated monkeys has both antibacterial and antitoxic properties, providing preventive and curative effects against the typhoid bacillus and its intracellular toxin.
